moq_settings.title: MOQ Settings
moq_settings.description: Configure Minimum Order Quantity (MOQ) globally for D fix
moq_settings.card_desc: When enabled, all products will require a minimum order quantity unless overridden at product or variant level.
moq_settings.enable_desc: Turn on minimum order quantity requirements globally
moq_settings.min_qty_desc: Customers must order at least this quantity for any product

info_list.3: If MOQ is disabled, quantity starts from 1 (normal behavior)

status.disabled: MOQ is Disabled - No minimum quantity restrictions

messages.validation_error: Minimum quantity must be at least 1

price_visibility.title: Price Visibility Settings
price_visibility.description: Control price visibility for guest users on D fix
price_visibility.hide_guests_desc: When enabled, prices will be hidden for non-logged-in users. Logged-in users can see all prices normally.

info_list.1: OFF (Default): All users can see product prices, variants, and add to cart
info_list.2: ON: Guest users see products but prices are hidden until they log in
info_list.3: Cart & Wishlist: Functionality remains normal for all users
info_list.4: Logged-in users: Always see full product details regardless of this setting

form.assign_partner_desc: Assign this coupon to specific partners for commission tracking. Partners will earn the specified commission percentage from orders using this coupon.

form.commission_calc_1: Commission is calculated on: ₹90 (Order value after discount)
form.commission_final_note: Commission is always calculated on the final order amount after applying the coupon discount.

categories.title: Categories
categories.subtitle: Organize your products with categories and sub-categories

empty.title: No categories found
empty.description: Create your first category to organize your products

what_is.title: What are Categories and Sub-Categories?
what_is.description: Categories are the main product groupings on your website (e.g., 'Women's Clothing', 'Men's Clothing', 'Electronics'). Sub-Categories are more specific groupings within a category (e.g., under 'Women's Clothing', you can have 'Dresses', 'Tops', 'Pants'). This hierarchical structure helps organize your products and makes it easier for customers to find what they're looking for.

step2.title: Create Sub-Categories:
step2.item1: Go to the category edit page (click Edit icon)
step2.item2: In the category edit form, you'll find sub-categories section

step3.title: Edit Sub-Categories:
step3.item1: Go to the category edit page
step3.item2: Find the sub-category you want to edit
step3.item3: Click the Edit icon next to the sub-category

step4.title: Delete Sub-Categories:
step4.item1: Go to the category edit page
step4.item2: Click the Delete icon next to the sub-category
step4.item4: Note: Products assigned to this sub-category won't be deleted

limit.title: How Many Sub-Categories Can a Category Have?
limit.info: There is no hard limit! You can create as many sub-categories as needed for each category. However, for better organization and user experience, we recommend:
limit.rec2: Too many sub-categories can make navigation confusing
limit.rec3: Too few sub-categories might not provide enough organization

ex1.title: Example 1 - Women's Clothing Category:
ex1.items: Dresses, Tops, Pants, Skirts, Jackets, Accessories

ex2.title: Example 2 - Electronics Category:
ex2.items: Mobile Phones, Laptops, Tablets, Headphones, Cameras

visibility.title: How to See Which Sub-Category Belongs to Which Category:
visibility.list_item1: Each category row shows the number of sub-categories it has
visibility.edit_item1: When you edit a category, you'll see all its sub-categories listed
visibility.edit_item2: Each sub-category shows its name, description, and image
visibility.edit_item3: You can see which category it belongs to from the page context
visibility.product_item1: When creating/editing a product, you select main categories first
visibility.product_item2: Then sub-categories appear grouped under their parent category
visibility.product_item3: Example: Under 'Women's Clothing', you'll see 'Dresses', 'Tops', etc.

appear.title: How It Appears on Your Website:
appear.page_products: Products shown based on selected sub-category

best_practices.title: Best Practices:
best_practices.bp1: Clear Naming: Use descriptive names for both categories and sub-categories
best_practices.bp2: Logical Grouping: Group related items together
best_practices.bp3: Consistent Structure: Maintain similar structures across categories
best_practices.bp4: Images: Add images for better visual appeal
best_practices.bp5: Product Assignment: Assign products to both main and sub-categories
best_practices.bp6: Regular Review: Update as your product range grows

tips.title: Tips:
tips.tip2: A product can belong to multiple sub-categories
tips.tip3: Use sub-category images for visual identity
tips.tip4: Keep sub-category names short and clear (1-3 words)
tips.tip5: Deactivate sub-categories instead of deleting if they might be used again

delete.force_description: This category cannot be deleted because it has products. You can force delete it (this will reassign all products to the default category), but this is not recommended.
